meanings.definition: A British slang term for a wealthy, fashionable young man.
meanings.sent1: The knut walked confidently down the street in his designer suit.
meanings.sent2: The knut was always seen at the trendiest clubs in town.
meanings.sent3: The knut's impeccable style made everyone turn their heads.
meanings.sent4: He was the knut of the group, always dressed to impress.
meanings.sent5: The knut's lavish lifestyle was the envy of many.

meanings.definition: A unit of currency in Sweden, equivalent to 100 öre.
meanings.sent1: She exchanged her knut for some local currency to buy souvenirs.
meanings.sent2: The price of the item was just a few knut more than she had.
meanings.sent3: He found a knut on the ground and joked about becoming rich.
meanings.sent4: In his dream, he dove into a pool of knut coins like Scrooge McDuck.
meanings.sent5: The knut in his pocket felt like a lucky charm.

meanings.definition: A type of fastening device used to secure a bolt in place.
meanings.sent1: He tightened the knut to make sure the bolt was secure.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic always carried a variety of knuts in his toolbox.
meanings.sent3: The knut rolled off the table and disappeared into the workshop.
meanings.sent4: She compared the knut to a tiny guardian keeping everything in place.
meanings.sent5: The shiny knut gleamed under the bright workshop lights.
